messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] 365 Cards yes please
messages.msgSnippet: I got a homeschooling catalogue from Scholastic today, which I flipped through briefly.  It seems to be mostly homework helper types of books, but I did see
messages.messageBody:
I got a "homeschooling" catalogue from Scholastic today, which I flipped
through briefly. It seems to be mostly homework helper types of books, but
I did see one thing that reminded me of the request for index cards - 365
Things to Do on A Saturday. The blurb says "Make guacamole, perform daring
experiments, create your own pin hole camera and much, much more. There is
no author listed, and I couldn't find it at Amazon, but I'll bet if you get
any of the Scholastic catalogues, you could order it from them. It might be
a good stop gap until Sandra gets around to hers.<g>

Jocelyn

> In a message dated 2/12/02 3:27:50 PM, homeschoolmd@... writes:
>
> << Sandra, how much would you charge for a pack of 365 index cards with hand
>
> written ideas on them? I'm very serious. >>
>
> You want to be the prototype test family?
>
> I should just do that, huh?
>
>
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
